name: Hilton Houston NASA Clear Lake

reviews.title: Very pleased
reviews.text: My husband and two young children took a short weekend trip to the Houston area and we loved the hotel. We had a great view overlooking the lake. The room were very nice. We enjoyed the pool and would have enjoyed the onsite water activities had we had more time. I would recommend spending the little extra to get a room with a view, because we found it to be very relaxing. We liked it so much we are going to make it a once a year tradition.

reviews.title: Good location, not much else
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times over the past 6 years on business trips to NASA. The view from the rooms can be great if you get one overlooking the lake, but most of the rooms are musty smelling, have old, tired looking decor, and broken fittings. Stay clear of the restaurant, the food is pretty bad.

reviews.title: All I can say is wow
reviews.text: The rates are usually quite low, so its not a bad deal, just don't expect it to be up to the standard of most Hiltons.
Visited the Houston area for a long weekend which included visits to Space Center Houston and Kemah Boardwalk. We like a full-service hotel and the Clear Lake Hilton did not let us down.
reviews.title: Great View-Great Location

reviews.text: Views from the HHonors floor overlooking the lake were great and our rate included continental breakfast vouchers with a $5 upgrade to the full buffet-$10 for breakfast for two is still a deal. Rooms were recently renovated and quite up to Hilton/4 star standards. Even with at least two weddings in the hotel the staff didn't seem over-taxed and was quite friendly. I will definitely use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Not worth the money
Loved the pillows
reviews.text: Hotel needs some major renovations. Air conditioning was noisy. Room I was assigned initially was smelling of smoke, though designated as non-smoking. Noisy too as the noise from other rooms could be heard clearly through the interconnecting doors. I was shocked to find that my 10 minute call to Canada cost me 50 dollars. Would not recommend this Hotel unless you are desperate.

We spent 2 nights in Houston and decided to get a hotel by Clearlake. Hotel was good, great beddings and pillows. However, when you check out, make sure you don't leave anything in your room. My daughter left a CD (autographed) in our room and I have contacted the hotel 4 times but I still have to hear from them. For a hotel like Hilton, I was expecting they would at least return my call to let me know whether they have the CD or not. I've been waiting for a week now.
reviews.title: Service Fiasco for Us

reviews.text: We had a terrible experience at the Hilton.
reviews.title: Great views, great family spot

aka: Hilton Houston Nasa Clear Lake Hotel
description: Our beautiful Clear Lake hotel boasts some of Houston hotels most breath-taking views. One of the best hotels near Houston, we pride ourselves on our service, recreation and access to water sports. Located only yards from the NASA Space Center, enjoy Houston's only waterfront hotel. Just 20 minutes from William P. Hobby Airport, this hotel lets you make the most out of your time in the area. Stay productive thanks to the 24-hour business center or get some work done from the comfort of your guest room thanks to the wireless internet access. All rooms and suites combine comfortable furnishings and signature beds with modern technology and impressive water views. Work out in the modern fitness center or swim in the outdoor pool. Relax with a poolside cocktail under the warm Texan sun with lake views or head to Luna restaurant for delicious cuisine in elegant settings. A range of 18 flexible function rooms include intimate boardrooms and grand ballrooms, offering space for up to 600 attendees.
